column1: American Civil Liberties Union at BU
column4: The ACLUBU is a student-led organization committed to educating and empowering students on civil rights, civil liberties, and civic engagement. Through thoughtful discussion, advocacy initiatives, and community action, we aim to foster a deeper understanding of the legal, political, and social issues that shape our world. Rooted in the mission of the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU), our club provides a space for students to explore pressing issues—such as voting rights, racial justice, reproductive freedom, LGBTQIA+ rights, criminal legal reform, and more—and equips them with the tools to become agents of change in their communities. As a collegiate organization affiliated with the ACLU of Massachusetts, ACLUBU offers students the opportunity to engage in real-world advocacy and civics education beyond the classroom. Members gain hands-on experience in organizing, learn the fundamentals of nonprofit and legislative work, and build meaningful connections with ACLU staff, community partners, and fellow student advocates. Whether you're passionate about justice, interested in legal systems, or simply looking to make a difference, BUACLU is a welcoming space to learn, grow, and take action. Learn more about ACLU issue areas here: https://www.aclum.org/en/issues

BU Alternative Investments Group (BUAIG) aims to enhance our community's knowledge of non-public investments and create a networking platform for sharing ideas and interests. These investments include hedge funds, commodities, real estate, and private equity, all of which offer significant career opportunities. We find it to be very important for students to be educated on these topics, as it will play a huge role in their career paths. BUAIG supports its members with a robust curriculum, centered around a semester-long case competition. Throughout the semester, members work in teams to develop an investment thesis for the case, while receiving feedback from mentors and professors. Members also gain professional development through keynote speakers, networking events, and a weekly job opportunities mailing list. Each semester concludes with students presenting their work to a panel of judges for constructive feedback. Join our mailing list to stay informed about meetings and case competition opportunities. Note that requesting membership on Terrier Central does not automatically add you to the mailing list. If you have any questions, please contact us at buaig@bu.edu.

The UAA is an organization for undergraduate students interested in architecture, design, urbanism, and real estate. Our goal is to foster a community that supports students in furthering their study of the built environment through themed discussions, professional panels and workshops, events, and field trips.

BUAS is a newsletter club dedicated to encourage BU Chinese international students engage in local campus activities, explore Boston culture, and connect with other students through publishing newsletters, social media posts, and pop-up events.

BU Automotive Club acts as a forum that enables automotive enthusiasts to discuss, debate, participate and fulfill their motor vehicle related desires to the fullest. Podcasts, debates, quizzes, contests are some of the ways through which Terriers would show their passion for vehicles. Additionally, we hope to have weekly releases of articles/podcasts from the members of the club where they would write/talk to express their knowledge about motor vehicles and share their opinions on their desired vehicles to provide a personal touch. We would also organize trips to auto expos, automotive factories or racing events and plan on road trips during the weekends to places in and around Boston. These road trips are planned to take a break from the academic life and quench the thirst for driving many terriers would have! We look forward to conducting many more driving related events in order to fulfill the driving desires of many students at BU. Moreover, we would bring in speakers throughout the semester to interact and have fun conversations with car lovers from our club and around the globe!

column1: Association for Women in Mathematics: Student Chapter
column4: BUAWM works to increase the access that underrepresented groups have to the study of mathematics and to a supportive math community, with a focus on women undergraduate math students (but non-majors are welcome!). We aspire to be an organization that embraces diversity, inclusion, and equity so that our members can enjoy a welcoming, collaborative community. We accomplish this through hosting social, academic, & professional math events, as well as hosting initiatives & projects that promote our mission. These events & projects range from faculty panels to movie nights to collaborating with the departmental Antiracism Speaker Series to an introductory course study-buddy system. We work jointly with MAA. Whether you have a passing interest in mathematics, or a passion for the subject, or an interest in math activism, we'd love to have you!

Boston University Barbell Club aims to become the most reputable resource for fitness, weight training, and exercise science information as well as be a community and social outlet for training enthusiasts. We are accomplishing these goals through: building a strong community that members can rely on, alleviating the weight training intimidation barrier, and ensuring an inclusive and supportive environment. We also support and encourage all competitive lifting interests through student led teams.

BU BassLine is an all gender a cappella group made by people of color for people of color. Our goal is to empower BIPOC students at BU, helping them find their voice and a community through music. BU BassLine is committed to partnering with clubs and organizations that upholds diversity, equity, and inclusion values. Our repertoire will consist of songs by POC artists with genres ranging from R&B, soul, funk, and more.

The core purpose of the BU Beatboxing club is to enhance the BU community through showcasing the under-appreciated art form/subculture of beatboxing through providing teaching and education to musically inclined students to continue practice.

The Boston University Burmese Student Association is an all-inclusive student association primarily aiming to help promote Myanmar's culture and tradition to the BU community through exciting interest information sessions and cultural events.

The Boston University Business Law Club is organized to bring more awareness to the Law field. Through our classes, we have recognized a need for an organization that encourages people to challenge different ideas in a safe environment. Many people are interested in law, but aren't sure if they want to pursue taking a class in it for an entire semester. We wanted to bridge that gap and share opportunities to engage in the Boston law community as well as offer a stress free environment where people can get a glimpse into what law really entails. For more information about the club please email bostonubizlaw@gmail.com or DM on Instagram @bubusinesslaw

BU CleanTech Club aims to create an engineering-focused community of students and faculty interested in the advancement of environmentally sustainable technology. JOIN OUR SLACK: https://join.slack.com/t/bucleantechclub/shared_invite/zt-1gcfukvn5-z1_z7gma9KCRYRBB2o8iBA SUBSCRIBE TO OUR NEWSLETTER "CleanTech" or "cleantech" is an all-encompassing term that involves much more than renewable energy. Advanced materials, sustainable protein, electric vehicles, water treatment, waste management, geoengineering, and indoor farming are some of the many industries in the cleantech space. As this technology continues to play an ever-increasing role in the fight against climate change, the CleanTech Club will offer a hub of discussion and application to better prepare students to face this global crisis. Our goals as an organization are as follows: Increase the presence of cleantech knowledge within the BU community. Inspire sustainable innovation through engineering and technology. Invite students, faculty, and industry professionals to learn from one another. Impact the local and global environment positively and directly. As we continue into this age where there is an ever-increasing growth of advanced technology and an equally increasing need to aggressively address global environmental issues, the Boston University CleanTech Club strives to create a space on campus where both the discussion of these issues and the actions necessary to help fix them are encouraged, allowing for students of all disciplines to come together and make a difference.

The Boston University College Republicans (BUCR) is a student organization dedicated to promoting conservative values and fostering a free marketplace of ideas on campus. Our weekly meetings focus on engaging with current political issues from a Republican perspective, aiming to find common ground and strengthen our understanding of differing viewpoints. We also host a range of events, including debates and watch parties, to unite conservative students and create a stronger political culture at BU. Follow us on Instagram for updates on upcoming events and activities!

column1: Graduate Chinese Students and Scholars Association - 47600
column4: BU Chinese Student Scholar Association (CSSA) was founded in 1994. It is a nonprofit organization of Chinese students and scholars who are currently studying or working at Boston University. In addition to promote academic and cultural exchange with other communities of different cultures, the ultimate goal of BU CSSA is to enhance the communication, interaction, understanding and friendship in the BU Chinese community.

We are an undergraduate academic club committed to providing students with high-quality data sciencetools and resources they need to make an impact in the ever-changing world of big data. By creatingopportunities, expanding accessibility, and building communities, we support the growth of ourmembers and help build an active and energetic environment for passionate data scientists.Whether you are a student at CAS, SMG, SHA, COM, ENG, or any other College at Boston University, youwill encounter data science and statistics. You might deal with raw data, read and learn from summarized data relevant to your field of study, or even take courses in data science or statistics. The ubiquity of data science and its applications to academic and professional disciplines have no limits. Outside of the academic realm, data science is becoming an increasingly indispensable part of our everyday lives. When you read an article online, or research a topic for your class paper, you are very likely to see data science methods or statistical measurements used in support of the arguments of interest. For these reasons, we believe that data science literacy is crucial in the world of information and technology that we now live in. It is essential to succeed academically, build a foundation for your career, and to preserve your integrity as a consumer and supplier of information. These beliefs and principals are the ones that we carry with us in hope of being accepted and received by you. These are the beliefs and principals that make up the core of the Boston University Data Science Association. Our goals are to:??Become your gateway to the plethora of data science and statistical events happening in theBoston area and Boston University??Build a framework within which you may explore your own interests, while learning andpracticing data science/statistics and data science/statistical tools??Connect you with professionals and experts in data science/statistics and its applications??Create and inform opportunities for your personal development in areas such as research,internship, communication, presentation, and group work??Bring together students of diverse backgrounds and interests to socialize, connect, network, andhave fun!

Boston University has a dedication and an obligation to advance climate resilience goals such as strong communities and local food systems. Join this club to help build a greener campus ecosystem with fresh local produce and learn about food production!

The Bug Club offers a community that engages students in the study of insects, known as entomology. Through discussion panels, guest speakers, group events, and club field trips we explore the various applications that insects have such as in our economy, medicine, as a food source, and in various fields of research. Feel free to hop in a meeting. We don't bite ;)

The Boston University Gliding & Soaring Club is a recreational group offering gliding and soaring experiences, aviation events, and glider training. We provide a range of activities, including VR simulators, ground school, and affordable gliding opportunities for aviation enthusiasts. Our events include glider build nights, movie nights, resume workshops, and talks with experienced professionals in the aviation industry. Our club is open to anyone interested in gliding and soaring. Whether you're a seasoned pilot or new to aviation, join our community of like-minded individuals who share a passion for the skies!

Girls Who Code Boston University is a student group that aligns with the efforts of the national Girls Who Code organization, to close the gender gap in tech. We aim to do this by empowering our community with skill-building, networking events, and mentorship with the national organization. We regularly host programming workshops, professional development workshops, and social events! We also run a mentorship program and a volunteer program to teach students 3-12 how to code. Anyone is welcome to join regardless of gender or major!

From its conception, the Boston University Hindu Cultural Association aims to promote awareness of the Hindu religion and to foster a greater understanding of Hindu heritage among the Boston University community. We strive to broaden and enrich the experiences of our community by providing a platform through which people can freely practice, discuss, and learn more about Hinduism. We also aim to raise awareness about social, political and religious issues affecting Hindus in the 21st century.

Established in 1990, In Achord is Boston University's premiere all-gender a cappella group. Recently, In Achord has been featured on the BOCA 2021 and 2023 (Best of College A Cappella) albums. In Achord competes in a cappella tournaments around the nation, most notably, the International Competition of Collegiate A Cappella (ICCA). In 2016, In Achord won the ICCA Northeast Quarterfinal hosted at the Berklee College of Music, and then went on to place fourth at the Northeast Semifinal while getting the opportunity to sing on Boston Symphony Hall's stage. In addition to being a competitive a cappella group, In Achord is also a family, and loves to have fun along the way! In their free time, the members of In Achord can always be found studying, hanging out, and exploring Boston together. The group also loves to gig throughout the school year, whether that be performing with groups at neighboring universities, singing at weddings, or hosting our very own Beanpot of A Cappella every spring. In Achord strives to be creative with our music while having a good time, emphasis on the good time. Over our 30 years as a student group at Boston University, In Achord has recorded several studio albums, with our most recent EP Theoretically, Forever. We pride ourselves on our R&B & Pop-inspired repertoire, our in-house arrangements, and our talented soloists. With a set ranging from Beyoncé to Allen Stone to Hozier to Couch, In Achord loves to perform at all events!

column1: Journal of History at Boston University
column4: Boston University's only Undergraduate peer-reviewed history publication.

A group for Undergraduate students at Boston University. JOC is a student organization dedicated to providing a space for conversation, community, advocacy, and mentorship for journalists who identify as people of color or for BU students interested in journalism. We intend on having bi-weekly meetings, special events, and lectures with guest speakers within the Boston community.

column1: Latin American Student Association at Boston University
column4: LATAM is a welcoming space for students from all around Latin America. Our goal is to create a sense of community within BU, where Latin American students can meet, connect and make lifelong friends through different social, recreational and professional events.________¡Un espacio hecho por Latinos, para Latinos!

Bulletproof Funk is Boston University's one-of-a-kind dance group dedicated to street dance. We focus on breaking (b-boying and b-girling also known as breakdancing), popping, and locking but do not limit ourselves to these styles. Although we love to perform and put a lot of effort into producing the best shows that we can, we created our group primarily as a way for us to individually practice and hone our skills. This explains the "open group, invite only performance" mentality that we hold. We encourage those who are interested in learning any of the aforementioned dance styles to come to our practices and talk to any of the members, as we are always willing to help others learn. We have performed at many colleges and events, usually combining with Boston College's Conspiracy Theory dance group under the moniker "Bulletproof Theory." Our past performances range from student group cultural shows to opening up for Boston rap icons Mr. Lif and Akrobatik.

Moot Court competition (simulated legal argumentation before hypothetical appellate courts, also known as “Mock Supreme Court”) is an educational opportunity to prepare the next generation of legal professionals. This club prepares individuals in team oral advocacy regarding the most pressing Constitutional issues of our time. The purpose of this organization is to educate undergraduate students about the United States legal system, jurisprudence, and the work of American attorneys. We compete and aspire to win at the highest level of competition attainable while offering opportunities to travel nationwide.

Boston University Marketing Club is committed to providing an opportunity for the BU community to explore all facets of marketing. Members of BUMKC gain experience by functioning in one of of our four committees: social media, content, client accounts, or case studies. Within each of these committees our members are driven to explore, diversify their knowledge, and grow. We are Boston University Marketing Club. Discover your brand today.

What we do: We are a group of students that aim to build the best Mars Rover to compete in the University Rover Challenge (URC) annually. URC, supported by the Mars Society, is the world's premier university robotics competition that aims to build the next generation of Mars rovers that will work alongside astronauts on the Red Planet in the future. In addition, we plan on reaching out to other local high schools to teach teenagers about Mars, robotics, and life science. Who we are: Although most are engineering students in 4 different fields: mechanical, electrical, computer, and biochemical engineering, the team also has businesses and other stem students. In fact, in 2022, about 30% of members are from the College of Art and Science, according to our stats. We currently have 55+ active members committed to our rover team technical project, planning outreach events, and fundraising in the upcoming school year. How we run the Mars rover club and technical team: The E-Board members plan and conduct outreach events, raise money and host weekly meetings to help members keep up with the competition schedule. We are assembled into eight sub-teams to work on four different competition missions depending on their interests and skills. These four missions are: A Science Mission to investigate a site for the presence of current or past life. A Delivery Mission to deliver a variety of objects to astronauts in the field across rugged terrain. An Equipment Servicing Mission to perform dexterous operations on a mock lander using a robotic arm. An Autonomous Traversal Mission to autonomously travel to a site and locate a marker.

Our club's goals are centered around widening optometry/ophthalmology fields, exploring general practices, research, and shadowing opportunities. These goals will be achieved through club meetings, doctor and medical student panels, convention trips, and offering volunteer opportunities.

BU Prevent Mission & Vision Statements Who We Are BU Prevent is an undergraduate student association based in preventive medicine and service. We aim to provide targeted preventive health services to the Boston University community in order to improve overall wellness. Our preliminary polling and conversations with the community have revealed some deeply unsettling facts. Among these are that 82% of BU undergraduates do not have a primary care physician in Boston, 61% do not meet health recommendation guidelines on good eating habits, and 38% have faced a serious health concern since beginning their college careers. Through thoroughly researched and approved wellness campaigns, naloxone and alcohol poisoning awareness trainings, and preventive care education, we will create a safer, healthier BU. Mission Statement The primary purposes of this organization are: Instill a preventive care mindset in the next generation of healthcare professionals. Create and communicate productive service initiatives for Boston University undergraduate members to participate in. Increase health and wellness at large in the Boston University community. Vision Statement BU Prevent aims to be the biggest targeted service initiative in the undergraduate community, providing a network of like minded, driven students who come together to improve Boston University and serve their peers.

The BU PSA is a cultural group that will celebrate Palestinian culture and traditions, and engage with education on Palestinian history and the current way of life in Palestine. It will be a space for students to learn and create a community of BU students with a shared background or interest in Palestine.

We organize weekly trips always either within walking distance or via public transit that take us to local parks and birding hotspots. While doing this we make an effort to teach new birders how to make use of the free resources available to them, and how to access the locations and tools we use on trips later on their own. While we make that effort for new birders we also encourage avid birders to join us both for a sense of community, as well as to better learn how and where to look for birds and natural places around our very urban campus.

BUREC is at the forefront of real estate education and home to BU's student managed real estate fund. Members gain a deep understanding of various facets of the industry, positioning them for success in private equity, development, or other investment-related businesses. Please contact bureclub@bu.edu for more information.

The Boston University Recreational Tennis Club is a college tennis organization dedicated to fostering an inclusive, welcoming, and enjoyable atmosphere for tennis players of all levels. Our club provides members an opportunity to learn the game of tennis and improve their skills through organized practices, lessons, tournaments, and social events. Guided by our core values of community, leadership, hospitality, innovation, and fun, we aim to inspire and promote tennis for everyone. Our club offers structured opportunities to refine your skills and connect with fellow players. We host regular skill-development practices led by experienced players, providing valuable insights to elevate your game, regardless of your current level. BU Rec Tennis recognizes the importance of building a strong network. We organize social events to create a space for camaraderie and foster friendships within the club. Membership is open to full-time students at Boston University. We encourage players of all backgrounds to join us and become part of a dynamic and supportive tennis community at BU. Stay tuned for upcoming events by following us on our email listed below and our Instagram: @bu_rectennis *TO BE ON OUR EMAIL LIST USE THE LINK BELOW* *Updated as of JUNE 1, 2025* https://bu.us8.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=f2f24040105fcb0b5a515db95&id=6a9770cd42

The South Asian Student Association is a cultural organization that represents communities from Afghanistan, Pakistan, India, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, the Maldives, and Sri Lanka through a variety of professional, social, and service events.

The Boston University Sports Business Club (BUSBC) is an undergraduate organization for students looking to gain knowledge of and exposure to the business side of the sports industry. This encompasses a variety of functional areas such as sports media/journalism, sports management, sports law, data/analytics, finance, marketing/advertising, and more. BUSBC hosts guest speakers, industry panels, and other sports-oriented events throughout the school year in order to enhance students' understanding of the various fields available, as well as generate networking opportunities. Additionally, BUSBC has partnered with BU Athletics to form the Sports Consulting Group, a division of the club that provides consulting work for our NCAA Division I teams to give students hands-on experience in the sports industry.

BU Songwriters Circle Welcome to the BU Songwriting Circle! Our organization is dedicated to fostering a vibrant community of aspiring songwriters, musicians, and lyricists. Whether you're a seasoned songwriter or just starting out, our club provides a supportive environment where creativity and collaboration thrive. Our mission is to inspire and empower students to express themselves through music. We believe that everyone has a unique story to tell, and through songwriting, we can share these stories with the world. Our club offers a variety of activities and resources to help you develop your skills and connect with like-minded individuals. Key features of the College Songwriting Club include: Workshops and Seminars: Led by experienced members, these sessions cover topics such as songwriting techniques, lyrical composition, music theory, and performance skills. Collaborative Projects: Team up with fellow members to co-write songs, produce tracks, and perform live. These projects provide valuable hands-on experience and foster a sense of community. Open Mic Nights: Showcase your original songs in a supportive environment. These events are a great opportunity to gain performance experience and receive constructive feedback. Songwriting Challenges: Participate in themed songwriting challenges designed to spark creativity and push your boundaries. Join us at the College Songwriting Club and be part of a community where your musical ideas can flourish and your voice can be heard!

We aim to identify students who demonstrate an interest in biomaterials, to generate student interest and interaction with biomaterials, and to aid the efficacy of students seeking research, education, and professional development opportunities.

The Boston University BizTech Club aims to: - Target students who think critically, problem-solve, and strive to understand and utilize technology on an ongoing basis. - Educate and further develop an understanding of career paths associated with a degree in various fields including but not limited to: Business, Engineering, Economics, Data Science, and more! - Connecting companies and other organizations with project, internship and job inquiries to talented and driven students. - Fostering a strong connection with students interested in pursuing a career in tech as well as building strong relationships with technology focused faculty and alumni.

The BU Ski & Board Club is a student-run group that organizes ski/snowboard trips for people of all abilities! BUSBC is a great way to meet people who love snow sports. We here at BUSBC believe life is better lived outside!

At the Boston University Skincare Club (BUSC), we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and welcoming environment for all individuals to enhance their skincare journey. We strive to create a safe space where everyone is invited to share their knowledge, regardless of where they are on their skincare journey. Through events focusing on different cultures, areas of concern, and career fields, BUSC aims to promote education and confidence in skincare routines. Our vision is to create a community where skincare can be utilized as a form of self-care. We aspire to become a trusted source for individuals seeking to understand and care for their skin.

The goal of the Boston University Trading Card Games Club (BU TCG) is to provide the BU community with the opportunity and means to play and enjoy trading card games (TCGs). TCGs such as Magic: the Gathering, Pokemon, Flesh and Blood, Yugioh, and more have been gaining popularity in the past years with the addition of new products and opportunities for players. We are a safe place for players of all skill in any of these games. We primarily focus on MTG, but among our eboard we know most TCGs and would be down to learn any we don't know with you. For MTG events, we do consistent cube drafts where the winner will get featured on our discord and instagram. Also, about every other week we do a draft of the current set or a slightly older set where you can sign up for free or pay to keep your cards. In addition, we always have a few commander/edh pods going that you can jump in. To get involved the best thing is joining our discord: https://discord.gg/8Qwp5N8cTc. We always post the events a few days in advance and it's a great place to ask questions and talk about your favorite game. In addition, we just created our instagram called butcgclub where will post event announcements. We also live stream our events now! Check out our twitch channel at https://www.twitch.tv/butcgclub and hit the follow button. If you are interested in commentating or casting, the mic is open to anyone! Fall 2025 Meeting Days: Monday Nights: 6-11pm CAS B25B Saturday Nights: BU TCG General Meeting - 4pm-11pm in CAS 222

Tech Talks is a dynamic and inclusive student organization dedicated to fostering a vibrant community of learners passionate about technology, data science, computer science, and innovation. Our mission is to provide a platform for students from diverse backgrounds and academic disciplines to explore, learn, and collaborate on cutting-edge topics in the tech industry. With experience in the tech courses, we understand how important hands-on experience, and mentorship are to empower individuals to excel in the rapidly evolving field of technology. Our club would offer a wide range of activities and opportunities designed to support students at every stage of their academic journey but also create a new teaching experience and spark more interest in the tech field for beginners and advanced learners. We are also aware of how important it is to show your knowledge through projects for future employers and internships and want to give aspiring students the opportunity to display their skill set effectively.

We operate with the goal of bringing together engineers from all fields of engineering and helping them find the opportunities and connections they want at BU! Our mission is to foster interdisciplinary collaboration, create a welcoming community, and serve as a central hub for engineering undergraduates across all disciplines. We are in the process of developing a mobile application which can be expanded but at its base will show BU students an easy to browse and constantly updated list of BU Engineering clubs, what they are doing, and how to contact them/get involved. This platform will serve as a live map of BU?? engineering ecosystem, making it simpler than ever for students to find organizations aligned with their passions, whether they??e looking to join competitive teams, advocacy groups, or professional societies. As the app grows, we hope to incorporate features like club event calendars, notifications, and student-submitted feedback to continually improve usability and engagement. Additionally, we will be talking to professors to have a list of much of the research going on at BU and how students can contact those professors. This resource will help demystify the research process, especially for younger students, by offering transparency and clarity into lab goals, required skills, and open positions. By highlighting current projects and making mentorship more approachable, we aim to lower the barriers to entering academic research and help students build long-term relationships with faculty. Aside from the mobile application, we will coordinate with other more specific academic engineering societies (like IEEE, MechE, Biomed Society, etc...) to hold combined social events where we can provide undergraduate engineering students with food, games, and the opportunity to meet students of similar or different backgrounds and interests, creating a more diverse and wider net for BUs blossoming engineers. These events are more than just casual gatherings??hey are networking opportunities, collaborative brainstorming spaces, and launching pads for future projects, friendships, and career exploration. We hope to create a culture where cross-disciplinary dialogue is both encouraged and celebrated. We also plan to be an accessible and knowledgable tool for newer and incoming students, offering up meetings or help to any students who request it. Whether it?? help navigating course selection, understanding major requirements, choosing electives, or preparing for internships, we want to be a go-to peer support system. We may direct them to where they need to go to get help, or give them the advice they need ourselves (from our own experiences). This could include student-run Q&A sessions, mentorship matching, or even one-on-one office hours led by upperclassmen. All around we plan to provide social cultivation for all students, and to provide assistance to anyone who needs it! By building a culture of openness, engagement, and support, we aim to uplift all members of the BU engineering community ??academically, professionally, and personally. We want to make it easier to navigate BU's wealth of opportunities.

Boston University Undergraduate Women in Economics serves: To bring together all minority genders interested in economics to create a community space and support system; To create opportunities for minority gender undergraduates to network with upperclassmen, graduate students, alumni, and faculty at BU and other colleges; and To facilitate discussions on gender and minority empowerment and economic theory on discrimination

Founded to bring innovators from around the world together and thrive in the vibrant atmosphere of Boston's Startup Scene, BUVCG's core values are "Innovate, Inspire, and Impact". We teach our members what it means to be in the VC industry through our rigorous Sourcing Analyst program: a semester-long program that includes workshops, deliverables, speaker series, tutoring hours, and a final presentation on the Term Sheet they create along the way. Our program allows members to experience both the Founder's and Investor's side of VC. In addition, we encourage our top Analysts to explore and continue their passion outside of work by inviting them to speak on our bi-weekly Podcast named "Venture Capital Today". This not only incentivizes members to dive deeper into independent research but also allows us to engage with a broader audience on social media and spread awareness of what VC truly is. BUVCG also aims to break barriers for marginalized groups to enter. We host an Annual Conference called "Women in VC" with the goal of changing the current VC landscape where women are only 2% of the industry. The group does not require any prior experience in VC to join, anyone with any level of knowledge is welcome. To learn more, visit our website: https://buvcg.org/ Follow us on social media for updates and reach out if you have any questions!Email: buvcgroup@gmail.comInstagram: bu_vcgLinkedIn: Boston University Venture Capital Group

We aim to promote and support student visual journalists in the advancement of their craft and career through portfolio reviews, connecting members with industry professionals, photography contest workshops, and more!

The Beta Chi chapter of Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Inc. was chartered on March 31, 2023. Beta Chi is a university-based, undergraduate chapter that seeks to serve the students and community of Boston University while upholding the sorority's principles of Scholarship, Service, Sisterhood, and Finer Womanhood.

BU Campus Activities Board (CAB) is the official event planning board for the undergraduate community. As a board, CAB uses a portion of the student activities fee to put on events that most benefit the BU community, and fulfill the mission of CAB: to bring students together and increase a feeling of connection. Some examples of previous events that CAB has held include Movie Nights, Board Games and Burritos Night, Salem Trip, Stuff Your Own Teddy, Drag Show, as well as discounted Celtics tickets. Additionally, CAB hosts Weeks of Welcome, the Junior Event, and Senior Week. If you have any event ideas you would like to see happen on campus, feel free to email us at cabbu@bu.edu or contact us on our social medias and let us know! Applications for intern positions open each fall! Follow us on Instagram @bu_cab to join us and stay updated on our latest events!

The Callbacks are BU's first and only comedy group that performs original sketch comedy, improvisational comedy, and produces video shorts. We have performed in Metcalf Auditorium, BU Central, Morse auditorium, and across the greater Boston area at Tufts University, Boston College, Brandeis University, and more! The Callbacks also host an annual collegiate sketch comedy festival at BU known as Funderdome! Visit our wesbite at thecallbacks.org and follow us on social media to learn more!

The mission of the Boston University College of Arts and Sciences Student Government (CAS StuGov) is to advocate for and represent the interests of the CAS student body. We seek to foster relationships within the CAS and Boston University communities by connecting students to resources in order to improve the quality of student life and encourage cross-discipline communication and relationships. In the BU community, CAS Student Government endeavors to be a connection point for all clubs, organizations, departments, and students that are found within the College of Arts and Sciences. As the largest school at BU, it makes our job as student leaders fun and diverse. Our main duties include: programming events, advocating for CAS student issues, improving transparency between administration & students, as well as providing resources for students to use and take part in. We have worked on issues ranging from Credit/No Credit to free menstrual products in all campus buildings. We have also organized large-scale campus events and traditions, such as the Comm Ave Carnival and '80s Roller Skating Night! We are always looking for new ideas and more involvement in CAS StuGov, so if you are interested in joining, contact any of our eBoard members, or stop by one of our many meetings & events! Follow us on Instagram: @cas_stugov

The Catholic Student Association is the ideal student group at Boston University if you're Catholic or interested in the faith. For many students, it is a home away from home. The CSA is a strong community of people looking to grow closer to God while forming genuine friendships and building community. Through the CSA, one can grow in his/her faith through the sacraments, service, social events and other various programs.

The Computing and Data Sciences (CDS) student government serves the interdisciplinary student community at CDS. Through advocacy, communication, and collaboration with our fellow peers, we aspire to make CDS feel like a tight-knit community. As we move into our new home in the Center, we hope to plan engaging events, build relationships with the administration, and always look out for the interests of CDS students. We always welcome new ideas and members in our meetings so feel free to come. Please let us know if you ever have any questions or concerns, and hope to see you at a CDS student government gathering. Feel free to follow our instagram: @cds.stugov

The Conscious Educators of Color club (C.E.C.) is dedicated to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment for Black and Brown educators and their peers to grow, have fun, and foster strong connections while advocating for justice-based education.

column1: Center for Gender Sexuality and Activism
column4: The CGSA is an open student-run safe space in the basement of the GSU. Each evening, a variety of student groups meet in the space. Free resources available to each and every student include condoms, tampons, bagels every Friday, arts and crafts supplies, a well-stocked library, the Womb Room, and plenty of comfortable seating.

The Student Government of the College of Fine Arts serves a community of musicians, actors, visual artists, and scholars. We ensure that our students maintain an active voice within the greater BU student body. CFA Student Government plans social and community building events for the college. We serve as a liaison between students, faculty, and administration. Student Government also organizes philanthropic events for its study body. We wish to share with the world the dazzling talents of our musicians, actors, visual artists, and scholars.

The College of General Studies Student Government Association (CGS SGA) is an organization which strives to represent the CGS student body and better connect them to the BU community through events, advocacy and communication. Through voicing the interests, concerns and proposals of the student body, we aim to inform the decision-making of the CGS administration, to encourage the participation of student leaders in policy making, and to bridge the gap between faculty and the student body to create a more cohesive, politically-active, and unified community.

The Chabad Jewish Student Organization provides opportunities, both individual and collective, for the Boston University Student Community to experience the unique approach it has to Jewish living, knowledge, and practice. Chabad presents Judaism, invigorated with the depth and vitality of Chassidic thought, philosophy, and Jewish Mysticism. One of its major goals is to provide culturally enriching social events and an atmosphere to celebrate Jewish holidays, engage in discussion, and immerse in learning - available to the entire BU community, regardless of affiliation, background, or beliefs. The Chabad House of Greater Boston, serves as a common meeting ground for the Chabad JSO, as part of the world-wide network of Chabad-Lubavitch that is dedicated to furthering the understanding and observance of Jewish traditions to all, regardless of their background, in the spirit of the teaching and example of the Lubavitcher Rebbe, Rabbi Menachem M. Schneerson. Through Shabbat and holiday programs, classes, and events - the Chabad House serves as home for the JSO and any other students interested in learning more.

Chankaar is Boston University's premiere all-female bollywood fusion dance team. We combine a variety of different dance forms, such as bollywood, bhangra, hip-hop, contemporary, and classical forms. Through our choreography and performance, we present distinct South Asian culture to the Boston University community. As a nationally-recognized dance troupe, Chankaar competes in various cities: most recently, Waco, TX, Charlottesville, VA, and Detroit, MI. By creating our sets and routines, we channel our energy, creativity, and talents to captivate our audience with our love for dance.

The Boston University Cheerleading Team is a competitive NCA Division I Team. BU Cheer brings Terrier spirit throughout Boston University and in the community. The team cheers and performs at all men's and women's home basketball games, brings their cheerful spirits to hockey games where they participate in activities such as t-shirt tosses and face painting/tattoos and provides spirit for other on-campus and community events.

Chemia is the undergraduate chemistry student organization at Boston University. Through direct collaboration with the chemistry department, we foster a community for students in the molecular sciences to support each other, provide peer mentorship, and grow as scientists. Ultimately, we aim to guide and support students, share our excitement about chemistry, and expand the community of scientists. We offer free tutoring for all undergraduate chemistry courses, including general, organic, inorganic, biochemistry, and physical chemistry. We also host events such as information sessions about research opportunities and graduate school, industry tours, meet and greets, professional development, and professor talks. Our events are open to anyone with an interest in chemistry. Follow our Instagram @buchemia for the most up-to-date information, or email us at buchemia@bu.edu if you have any questions!

The purpose of BU Chess is to act as a community hub for chess enthusiasts at Boston University. The club will provide chess resources and a place to play for undergraduates. BU Chess aims to promote the game of chess to the Boston University community, provide a friendly environment for chess players to engage, and formulate a BU Chess Team to compete in the Collegiate Chess League, other Collegiate Tournaments, and regional tournaments. Follow us on instagram: https://www.instagram.com/buchessclub/

Founded in 1824, the Chi Phi Fraternity is the oldest men's college fraternity in existence today. Truth, Honor and Personal Integrity are the hallmarks of our fraternity. We currently maintain 54 chapters and four colonies located at prestigious universities throughout the United States, with a combined membership of 2,500 undergraduates and 38,000 living alumni. Since 1989, the men of the Tau Zeta chapter of of Chi Phi Fraternity have stood for truth, honor, and personal integrity. The brotherhood demonstrates its dedication to the Boston University community through philanthropic ventures, academic excellence, athletics, and social engagement. The Tau Zeta Chapter of the Chi Phi Fraternity was established at Boston University in 1989 and colonized nationally in March of 1995. Whether it be creating an impact at Boston University or leaving a positive effect for the organizations we support, Tau Zeta prides itself on the philanthropic dedication of the brotherhood. Every semester we hold charitable events at every level. In fall of 2022, we raised over $3,000 for Planned Parenthood. In the fall of 2023, we raised over $2,000 for Maui Strong. In the past we've raised money for various organizations including RAINN, BARCC, and social justice organizations.

Boston University Chinese Student Association is a student group dedicated to promoting Chinese Culture and fostering friendship in the Chinese Community. We welcome people of all backgrounds and nationalities to join us, to celebrate and learn traditions that have endured for thousands of years. As the largest cultural group on campus, and one of the leading student groups at BU, we offer a range of activities and events for our members. Whether you're interested in cultural extravaganzas, lessons in dumpling making, or dinner outings with your fellow students, we encourage you to come experience the benefits that CSA has to offer.

BU Choral Society is a non-audition, chorus where singers of ALL levels of experience are welcome! We sing a variety of fun and accessible music, culminating in multiple performances throughout each semester. We hope to be a space for you to decompress and experience the joy of making music together. BU Choral Society aims to ignite musical growth, inspire life long friendships, and most importantly to have fun! We hold bonding events throughout the year such as karaoke nights, attending live concerts, and enjoying restaurant outings. Follow our Facebook “BU Choral Society,” and our Instagram @buchoralsociety. Contact us at choral@bu.edu if you have any questions!

Hi! We're Chordially Yours, a treble-voiced a cappella group founded in 2000 by Beth Heald ('03)! You can call us Chords for short. We believe in using music to empower and celebrate women and nonbinary people. We've taken part (and placed) in a number of competitions and events, including the Faneuil Hall A Cappella Fest, the ICCAs, SheSings (by the Women's A Cappella Association), WGBH's Sing That Thing!, a performance in Downtown Disney, and even opened for Lena Dunham at the Boston stop of her Not That Kind of Girl book tour! We also have three EPs on Spotify and Apple Music, with more to come. If you're interested in learning more about Chords, check out our website chordiallyyours.com and feel free to shoot us an email at chordially.yours@gmail.com! You can also follow us on Facebook, Twitter @ChordiallyYours or Instagram @ChordiallyYoursBU

Our purpose is to help all the students gain a deeper understanding of the Bible to guide their lives. We have found that meeting together with other pursuing believers - including undergraduates, graduates, and families of the BU community - is the start to understanding and enjoying God's Word in our lives. We also have found that with an open and exercised spirit, all the mysteries of the Bible can become our daily reality. For questions or more details, check out our Instagram @buchristiansoncampus or email us at buchristiansoncampus@gmail.com.

BU Circle K International provides students with the opportunity to engage in community service on the local and international levels while gaining valuable leadership skills for the future. Our service project initiatives cover a wide range of interests. At any time, any member can suggest a service project and assume a leadership position in its execution. We aim to work not only with local charities and the Circle K International Service Partners (e.g. UNICEF), but also with other student organizations on campus in any capacity in which we are needed. BU Circle K International is sponsored by the Somerville Kiwanis and Greater Boston Young Professionals, who wish to work closely with us and will be regularly inviting members to volunteer with some of their ongoing service projects. We strive to be a driving force for community service on campus and to bring a positive influence to the Greater Boston Area.

The Boston University Climbing Club is a recreational social group that enables students to discover rock climbing. We regularly climb at fitrec and other Boston area gyms. Weather permitting, we lead outdoor Bouldering and Roped climbing trips to the many New England crags. Welcoming to climbers of all skill levels! Come climb with us!

In Club Colombia, Colombian students and those interested in the country come together for activities that create a sense of community such as cooking together, celebrating holidays, watching fútbol games, trying restaurants, and hosting guest speakers.

All Club Sports are overseen and advised by program managers from the Department of Physical Education, Recreation & Dance. Use this link to learn more about the various club sports on-campus. Our program offers 37 different student-run Club Sports teams. Some play casually for the fun of it. Others practice regularly for intercollegiate and tournament competition. Many have coaches to help you develop your skills and strategize your next victory. The Club Sports at BU are as follows: - Badminton - Baseball - Men's Basketball - Women's Basketball - Cricket - Cycling - Equestrian - Fencing - Figure Skating - Golf - Gymnastics - Men's Ice Hockey - Women's Ice Hockey - Inline Hockey - Jiu Jitsu - Kendo - Kung Fu - Men's Rugby - Women's Rugby - Sailing - Shotokan Karate - Ski Racing - Snowboarding - Men's Soccer - Women's Soccer - Squash - Women's Synchronized Skating - Synchronized Swimming - Table Tennis - Tennis - Triathalon - Men's Ultimate Frisbee - Women's Ultimate Frisbee - Men's Volleyball - Women's Volleyball - Men's Water Polo - Women's Water Polo

BUCD seeks to inspire Democratic change in government by motivating young progressives to get involved in the political sphere. We have an engaged presence on the Boston University Campus, organizing action around initiatives from the national to university level. BUCD commits to action in and around Boston, Massachusetts, and the country, pushing for value-based change. We have meetings every Thursday at 7 pm on campus to discuss, debate, and educate ourselves on local and national politics, while engaging in civic action to make an impact. Join our slack!

ACS On Campus is a nationwide collaboration of college students, faculty, and staff dedicated to eliminating cancer through a variety of events. In collaboration with the American Cancer Society, we promote awareness and education in the BU community about cancer-related topics, recognize and honor survivorship in Boston, fundraise for ACS so that the money can go towards patient care and research, and advocate to make cancer a top priority in legislation, on-campus, as well as at state and federal levels. Furthermore, we plan the annual Relay for Life event (hundreds of participants!) for a night of celebration, remembrance, and call to action in all aspects of cancer. Join us in the fight!

column1: The College of Communication Student Government
column4: The College of Communication Student Government is the governing undergraduate student body of COM. COM Student Government serves as a liaison for students, faculty, administration, and alumni. Our mission is to promote unity, academically and socially, among all COM students and Boston University: We push to create a better environment for our students and faculty for an everlasting effect. We strive to provide students with an effective voice in COM. Create social media content and web series to promote COM and give students an outlet to create. We plan various events throughout the year with the primary focus of promoting DEI and networking opportunities for all COM students. Some of these events in the past have included COMapalooza, the Commonwealth Film Festival (BU's Student Short Film Festival), the Annual COM Town Hall (a platform for COM students and staff to get engaged in discussion), Cheers and a Chat with Dean DiChristina, and more! Our general meetings are held on a weekly basis and are open to all COM undergraduate students. This Fall 2025, we will have biweekly meetings occurring on Wednesdays from 6:00-7:00 PM in COM 101. So if you're a COM student looking to get involved, COM Student Government is for you! We'd love to meet you and hear your ideas! Don't hesitate to contact us for more information and meeting times at comgov@bu.edu. Connect with us for more information and updates: Website: https://www.comstugov.com/ Instagram: @comstugov

The Boston University Consulting Group is a collaborative organization that focuses on career development in the field of consulting for students of all academic backgrounds. We prepare students for a career in consulting through comprehensive workshops, mock interviews, and alumni panels to equip its members with confidence and experience. We also offer pro bono and paid consulting solutions to clients in Boston and its surrounding area. For this area of our club, we bring together engagement teams of dedicated and diverse undergraduates with strong business acumen and a passion for problem-solving. Many of our engagement team members have excelled in internships at renowned firms and contribute these acquired skills to their teams. Our services comprise of strategic recommendations that add value to our clients' enterprises. If you are interested in joining our club, sign up for our Mailing List at www.buconsultinggroup.com/mailinglist for more information!

Welcome to Cru! Cru at BU is a local chapter of the national movement of Cru. We are a community for students from all backgrounds who desire to grow and experience the love of Jesus together. We meet weekly in large groups with other students around Fenway and in small discipleship groups (G3's) throughout the week. We also offer a number of opportunities throughout the year to connect with each other and share Christ.

The Student Leadership & Impact Center combines the work of the CSC and SAO. The Community Service Center (CSC) has served as a welcoming space for service, leadership, education, and reflection. In solidarity with our neighbors and community partners, we aim to: provide the Boston University community with opportunities to address and improve the critical concerns of Greater Boston, serve as a vehicle for personal growth and leadership, encourage students to be active and responsible citizens in neighboring communities, broaden the scope of the educational experience through service and reflection, and serve Greater Boston in a meaningful and mutually beneficial way.

BUCSC is an undergraduate club that provides a platform for students to enhance their coding and problem-solving skills through speakers, networking events, and guidance. We create an environment for students who are CS majors or are interested in programming to create camaraderie with each other and foster their computer science journey.

Boston University's Cyber Security Association (CyS) strives to raise awareness on the value of cyber-aware leadership in the Cyber industry, foster a constructive community for students passionate about the role of cybersecurity in today's organizations, and those who want to learn more about the field and the impact it will have on organizations in every industry and economic sector. We create future business leaders that understand the value of cybersecurity with the necessary skills to succeed in the field even with a non-technical background.

Dance Theatre Group, a Boston University student organization established in 1972, is dedicated to building a community that values dance as an art form. Each semester, DTG offers weekly master classes in a variety of genres taught by the professionals in the greater Boston dance community. DTG also produces an end-of-semester performance that showcases student and faculty choreography. Throughout the semester, choreographers meet weekly with their casts and strive to create pieces that focus on non-verbal self-expression. Choreographers are also given the opportunity to benefit from mentor feedback at several points throughout the semester, learning to incorporate suggestions from three mentors with professional dance experience into their pieces. DTG gives its members the chance to not only grow as technicians but to also develop one's artistic voice. We are BU students that are passionate about dance, and we relish the chance to do what we love and share it with each other and our audience! For more information, visit the following pages: Fitrec Website: http://www.bu.edu/fitrec/dance/dance-theater-group/ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/budtg Instagram: @bostonudtg Tik Tok: @bostonudtg If you have any questions, please e-mail DTG at dtg@bu.edu!

The team performs at men's and women's basketball games, on-campus events, community service events, and local dance showcases, and competitions. The team competes in the Division I category at the NDA Collegiate National Championship in Daytona Beach, FL. The team has finished in the Top Ten since 2013 and won National Titles in 2014 (Hip Hop) and 2016 (Team Performance).

We aim to promote better awareness of the Deaf Community and Deaf Culture by providing students with access to the Deaf Community. Our goal is to allow our members to form bonds within the Deaf Community to better understand the wants and needs. As well, we promote the idea of Deaf as culture, rather than disability. We host exciting events throughout the year, such as dances and performances, that our members as well as members of the Boston Deaf Community can attend!

The Boston University Debate Society competes as part of the American Parliamentary Debate Association (APDA) and participates in both American Parliamentary and British Parliamentary debate. Our team welcomes members from all backgrounds, with some members having prior experience with various forms of debate and with others who are completely new to the activity. As part of BUDS, you'll have the opportunity to attend tournaments at other colleges and universities as frequently as you like, with options offered most weekends of the academic year.

Delta Delta Delta was founded in 1888 at Boston University with the goal to “found a society that shall be kind alike to all and think more of a girl's inner self and character than of her personal appearance.” As the first chapter of a now internationally respected Panhellenic women's organization, the Alpha Chapter at Boston University strives to uphold the sorority's fundamental values of kindness and steadfastly loving one another. Tri Delta gives collegiate women the opportunity to create their own community at BU and forge perpetual bonds of genuine friendship that last far past graduation.

Delta Gamma at Boston University. For Hope, For Strength, For Life. Delta Gamma Fraternity was founded in 1873 at the Lewis School for Girls by three young women: Anna Boyd, Mary Comfort, and Eva Webb. The greek letters Delta Gamma were chosen to represent our motto "Do Good." Doing Good remains central to our mission as a chapter, as we push ourselves to be the best women we can be. DG strives to foster high ideals of friendship among women, to promote their educational and cultural interests, to create in them a true sense of social responsibility, and to develop in them the best qualities of character. As a DG, you are exposed to resources and experiences that will empower you to live up to these ideals. Our chapter prioritizes service as a fundamental part of our college experience. We work with partners such as Perkins School for the Blind and the Massachusetts Association for the Blind and Visually Impaired (MABVI) that align with our philanthropic mission. If you are interested in learning more about our chapter or have any questions, please don't hesitate to reach out to Sasha at dgzzpresident@gmail.com

Established March 16, 1936, Delta Kappa Alpha is a National, Gender Inclusive, Professional Cinema Fraternity for cinematic arts students of character. As a National organization with over 75 years of history and alumni, our members are connected to the top cinema students from top cinema schools at universities such as USC, NYU, UCLA, Chapman, UT Austin, LMU, Columbia University, and many others. DKA is grounded in timeless personal and professional values and principles, and as an organization, our vision is to be recognized as the premier institute of upstanding entertainment industry leaders. Not exclusive to film studies majors, DKA welcomes all genders, undergraduates and graduates, who are dedicated to fostering lifelong character, collaborative and creative storytelling, ethical and productive business practices, philanthropic action, and fraternal bonds by and between students of the cinematic arts. If you have any interest in joining Delta Kappa Alpha or have any questions about us, you can contact our Recruitment Chairs at recruitment@bu.dka.org.

Delta Phi Epsilon International is an almost century old International Business & Foreign Service Society founded in 1919 at Georgetown University. Boston University's organization was founded in 1922 through the School of Business Administration. The society fosters a community of professionals who want to pursue an international career in business trade & development, economic policy, international relations, law, journalism etc. At Boston University we aim to help young students develop professional skills and become future world leaders, as well as advocates of world justice, peace, & prosperity. The society also seeks to develop a strong community of peers through a social and professional network of like-minded individuals. http://www.dpebostonu.com/ https://www.instagram.com/dpebostonu/ Primary Contact: Maia Lane, president.dpe.bu@gmail.com

Delta Sigma Pi was founded in 1907 and is America's foremost professional business fraternity. Since its founding, it has become the world's largest business fraternity with more than 230,000 members, and more than 200 active collegiate chapters and colonies at a diverse selection of colleges and universities across 47 different countries. Delta Sigma Pi is for life and we have a strong alumni network with chapters and groups in more than 100 cities across the globe. We also host the largest national convention of any business fraternity. As a collegiate, cultivate personal excellence through: Opportunities to lead, contribute skills and talents Community and university service activities Social interaction Time management workshops Career Fairs Etiquette Training Jobs and Internship Offers specifically for Deltasigs Distinguished Alumni Dominic A. Tarantino - Chairman Emeritus, PriceWaterhouseCoopers World Firm John G. Smale - Chairman of the Board and CEO (retired) of Procter & Gamble Company Joseph A. Kellogg Foundation Gregory W. Jones - President & CEO, State Farm General Insurance Co William R. Howell - Chairman Emeitus, J.C. Penny S. Truett Cathy - Founder & Chairman, Chick-fil-A, Inc. Katherine Ortega - Former Treasurer of United States Eduardo Aguirre, Jr. - Former U.S. Ambassador to Spain & Andorra The Gamma Chapter of Delta Sigma Pi was founded at Boston University in 1916. Our members are men and women who are leaders in the BU community, who are of good moral character, and who are pursuing a degree in the School of Management, the School of Hospitality or an economics degree in the College of Arts and Sciences. We have close connections with DSP's Boston Alumni Chapter as well as with our own Gamma alumni located throughout the country. Events Put on By Gamma Chapter: Professional Corporate Tours of State Street & John Hancock Brooks Brothers Dress for Success Guest Speaker Brad Karsh - former recruiter and founder of JobBound; featured on CNBC and in The Wall Street Journal Guest Speakers - project management, public speaking, entrepreneurship, money management, finance, and marketing Job and Internship offers for Deltasigs Leadership Conferences - Providence, Annapolis, Pittsburgh, Washington D.C., Cincinnati, Boston, Cleveland and Louisville Community Service Participate in walks to raise funds for charity - Light the Night, Lupus, JDRF, March for Babies, Relay for Life Toy Drive for Boston Children's Hospital; card-making on Halloween Holiday Cards for U.S. Troops stationed overseas Blood Drives with the American Red Cross Scrimmage softball games with hopeFound organization Tutoring adults working towards their GED in math-based subjects Charity Denim Social Dinners, ice cream, movie nights Harry Potter 7 Midnight Screening Big/Little Olympics Trip to Syracuse DSP Chapter - Tailgating and Football Rose Games - Olympic-style games versus other area DSP Chapters To learn more about us visit <span style="text-decoration

Dheem is Boston University's Premier Competitive Award Winning Indian Classical Dance Team. Dheem has been established in the Boston area for more than a decade. Performing in the styles of Bharatnatyam, Odissi, and Kathak, Dheem aims to preserve and celebrate its cultural heritage and raise awareness about relevant social justice issues. Through Boston University and surrounding colleges, Dheem provides a setting for classical dancers to collaborate and foster their respective dance forms.

The BU Diversity in Law Association (DLA) strives to create a space where students, particularly minority students, can learn about how law can affect their lives and how they can contribute to society through a legal career. As members of this organization, we would have the opportunity to hear professionals in the legal field share their experiences relating to the law and social justice issues. DLA will also disseminate information on career opportunities, scholarships, and law school preparation. Members can also take part in group visits to courthouses, law offices, and other venues related to the organization's purpose. DLA needs the participation of passionate pre-law students, activists, and other individuals interested in promoting diversity in law.

The Boston University Dodgeball Club will host weekly Dodgeball games, open to all full-time and part-time BU students. Courts will be rented for the duration of an hour, and we will play as many games as we can within that hour. We will follow a classic set of dodgeball rules, with two teams of equal strengths attempting to win by hitting all the players on the other team. We will use classic size, soft dodgeballs to prevent any kind of injury, and will maintain a safe environment for all of our members. These games will build teamwork, a love of sports, create lasting connections between BU students and will be, above all, very fun!

DREAM is a non-profit mentoring program that pairs college students with children from affordable housing communities in Boston. Our mission is to close the opportunity gap through engaging, educating, fun programmings that take place either on campus or in the city, every Sunday of the semester. If you're interested in becoming a DREAM mentor, please contact budreamrecruit@gmail.com to learn more about DREAM and get involved. We are currently expanding our program through rolling recruitment. If you're with another student organization interested in collaborating, please email charlesviewdream@dreamprogram.org

The Edge Dance Company at Boston University was founded in 2001 and has been a leading jazz/lyrical group on campus. Edge is a group of technically trained dancers with roots in "studio style" dance and performance/competition experience. Edge intends to promote the art of dance at BU and in the surrounding community while continuing to improve their skills as dancers. Follow our Instagram page @bu_edge and look for us at Splash and at Auditions in the fall!

The Boston University Egyptian Club is an organization seeking to celebrate the Egyptian culture. It is open to all BU students and staff, regardless of their ethnicity, political affiliations, religion, and sexual orientation; as we hope to boost relations between people of different backgrounds, educate the public about Egypt as a whole, and collectively promote prosperity and a better future for Egypt. It is also open for Egyptian students at BU to network with one another and with students of different backgrounds as well. We seek to achieve our primary objectives by occasionally holding cultural and informational events pertaining to Egyptian society so that we may spread our message to as wide an audience as possible, thereby raising awareness and credibility for our cause. We hope to build a warm, and welcoming community for all!

The Elementary Education Club aims to serve as a resource and forum for the all undergraduate students at Boston University interested in elementary education. Through community service, we contribute to the educational needs of children in the greater Boston community. The club serves as an academic resource, allowing for the sharing of student perspectives, and builds a community through meetings, discussions, social events, and volunteer opportunities. We warmly welcome anyone of interest, not just education majors.

We aim to bring together current and future students in EMS, or anyone else interested in emergency medicine. We aim to educate and inspire people about emergency medicine and life-saving techniques through collaborative events and regular meetings.

ENG Student Government (ENGGOV) is aimed at fostering loyalty, promoting school and class interest, establishing unification among the various classes, and acting as a liaison between students and the administration.

Established in 2005 at Boston University, Engineers Without Borders (EWB) is a collegiate chapter directly affiliated with the national chapter of EWB USA. EWB USA is a non-profit humanitarian organization that was established to partner with developing communities worldwide in order to improve their quality of life. This partnership involves the implementation of sustainable engineering projects, while involving and training internationally responsible engineers and engineering students. Our current work is with the Ogiek people of Tinet, Kenya, and we have past experience in Chirimoto, Peru, and Naluja, Zambia. We are a group of students from various majors who collaborate worldwide with communities and local partners to design and implement sustainable engineering projects with the aim to create transformative experiences and responsible leaders. Our current projects focus on bringing clean and sustainable water sources -- such as rainwater catchment systems and borehole wells -- to the elementary schools of the region. Explore our website to get involved: https://www.ewbbu.org/

BU Entrepreneur's Club is an organization for students of all backgrounds and majors to become part of the best community of student innovators at BU. We aim to help students build professional networks and start their own ventures by holding events each semester that allow members of our club to meet and network with other entrepreneurial students, VCs, advisory mentors, and inspiring entrepreneurs in the Boston community.

The Environmental Student Organization (ESO) strives to raise awareness about environmental justice issues and climate mitigation to create beneficial environmental change on BU's campus and in the surrounding community of Boston. Our weekly meetings are a place where all students can come together and learn something new about the environment. ESO works hard to create an atmosphere where driven students have the opportunity to congregate, socialize and make changes. Specifically, we are focused on making environmentalism INCLUSIVE and ACCESSIBLE, promoting activism at all scales and highlighting environmental justice. We participate in many environmental activities in the Boston area including urban gardening, weekend hikes, partnering with local zero waste businesses, and much more! Let's make BU a more environmentally friendly campus together! Check out our social media for our meeting time and follow us on Instagram @bu.eso. If you have any questions or want to be added to the mailing list, please email us at eso@bu.edu.

Epsilon Eta at Boston University is a multi-gender professional environmental fraternity that promotes a healthy and sustainable environment and connect students to industry, community service, and academia in pursuit of these goals.

We want to extend our warmest welcome to the Boston University Class of 2029! Our organization promotes cultural awareness of diverse ethnic backgrounds and provides a welcoming space on campus for Eritrean and Ethiopian students. Through supporting grassroots projects and activism in our Eritrean and Ethiopian American community, as well as giving back through partnerships with local non-profit organizations, we foster unity, active participation, acceptance, and integration among all Eritrean and Ethiopian Boston University students. We wish to educate members about the different aspects of Eritrean and Ethiopian culture through showcasing talents and performances (via our dance team), and inform the student body of social justice matters that are relevant to our world today. Ultimately, we aim to act as a collective voice for students and foster respect through uniting the voices of our diverse Eritrean and Ethiopian community. Follow and DM us on insta to connect with the community, or if you have any questions about BU! instagram.com/bu_eesa

Etc. Choir provides members of the BU community with the opportunity to sing in an inclusive ensemble which performs SATB works. Unique from other choral ensembles at BU, Etc. Choir was founded and led by students studying Music Education. Our goals center around teaching our members how to sing any type or genre of music Efficiently, Tastefully, and Consistently. Rehearsals will provide knowledge about choral singing and acting techniques. Etc. Choir will concentrate on performing music from a broad spectrum, including but not limited to Western and Non-Western classical, musical theater, and popular styles of music in a choral setting. A primary goal of this choir is to be inclusive to the Transgender and Queer communities who often struggle in the choral world due to the gendered nature of vocal parts. As such, vocal parts are assigned per song based on a student's most comfortable range rather than labeling a person to only one vocal part. Etc. Choir strives to be ensemble-centered and ensures that everyone is able to participate at all times.

column1: F1Tenth Autonomous Racing Organization at Boston University
column4: The F1Tenth Autonomous Car Racing Organization or ACRO at Boston University is a student-led organization dedicated to advancing research and innovation in autonomous systems, with a specific focus on the intersection of motorsports and computer vision algorithms. Our mission is threefold: to ignite passion for cutting-edge technologies, inspire curiosity in the field of robotics and artificial intelligence, and cultivate analytical thinking skills among our members. At the heart of our club lies a passion for a fascination with the intricate algorithms that power autonomous vehicles on a competitive level where we are constantly pushing new grounds for research and development. We believe that the high-speed, dynamic environment of racing tracks provides a unique testbed for developing and refining vision algorithms, decision-making systems, and control mechanisms that can later be applied to real-world autonomous vehicles. Our club members work collaboratively on designing, building, and programming 1/10th scale autonomous race cars, leveraging state-of-the-art computer vision techniques, machine learning models, and control systems. We strive to push the boundaries of what is possible in the realm of autonomous systems, exploring cutting-edge technologies such as deep learning, sensor fusion, and advanced perception algorithms. Through these hands-on projects, workshops, and competitions, our goal is for our members to gain invaluable practical experience in areas such as robotics, embedded systems, and software engineering. We encourage interdisciplinary collaboration, fostering an environment where students from diverse backgrounds, including computer science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, and physics, can contribute their unique perspectives and skills. Moreover, the F1Tenth Club at Boston University serves as a hub for knowledge-sharing and community-building. We organize guest lectures, seminars, and industry collaborations as well as collaborations with other schools such as MIT, providing our members with opportunities to learn from experts in the field and gain insights into the latest developments in autonomous systems.
